adjective.description: Relating to or concerning the five articles of doctrine enunciated by the Arminian Remonstrants, which were repudiated by the Calvinists at the Synod of Dort in 1618.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Pierce (d. 1691), dean of Salisbury and religious controversialist. From post-classical Latin quinquarticularis from classical Latin quīnque five + articulus + -āris.
